name: elasticstack
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing elasticstack cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`elasticstack` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vinaybabu16/terraform-provider-elasticstack).

username.description: A username to use for API authentication to Elasticsearch.

filter.description: Query used to limit documents the alias can access.

indexRouting.description: Value used to route indexing operations to a specific shard. If specified, this overwrites the `routing` value for indexing operations.

isHidden.description: If true, the alias is hidden.

isWriteIndex.description: If true, the index is the write index for the alias.

name.description: Index alias name.

routing.description: Value used to route indexing and search operations to a specific shard.

searchRouting.description: Value used to route search operations to a specific shard. If specified, this overwrites the routing value for search operations.

caFile.description: Path to a custom Certificate Authority certificate

password.description: A password to use for API authentication to Elasticsearch.

username.description: A username to use for API authentication to Elasticsearch.

allocate.description: Updates the index settings to change which nodes are allowed to host the index shards and change the number of replicas.

freeze.description: Freeze the index to minimize its memory footprint.

migrate.description: Moves the index to the data tier that corresponds to the current phase by updating the "index.routing.allocation.include.*tier*preference" index setting.

minAge.description: ILM moves indices through the lifecycle according to their age. To control the timing of these transitions, you set a minimum age for each phase.

searchableSnapshot.description: Takes a snapshot of the managed index in the configured repository and mounts it as a searchable snapshot.

setPriority.description: Sets a source index to read-only and shrinks it into a new index with fewer primary shards.

unfollow.description: Convert a follower index to a regular index. Performed automatically before a rollover, shrink, or searchable snapshot action.

minAge.description: ILM moves indices through the lifecycle according to their age. To control the timing of these transitions, you set a minimum age for each phase.

waitForSnapshot.description: Waits for the specified SLM policy to be executed before removing the index. This ensures that a snapshot of the deleted index is available.

provider.description:
The provider type for the elasticstack package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

generation.description: Current generation for the data stream.

hidden.description: If `true`, the data stream is hidden.

ilmPolicy.description: Name of the current ILM lifecycle policy in the streams matching index template.

indices.description: Array of objects containing information about the data streams backing indices. The last item in this array contains information about the streams current write index.

metadata.description: Custom metadata for the stream, copied from the _meta object of the streams matching index template.

name.description: Name of the data stream to create.

replicated.description: If `true`, the data stream is created and managed by cross-cluster replication and the local cluster can not write into this data stream or change its mappings.

status.description: Health status of the data stream.

system.description: If `true`, the data stream is created and managed by an Elastic stack component and cannot be modified through normal user interaction.

template.description: Name of the index template used to create the data streams backing indices.

timestampField.description: Contains information about the data streams @timestamp field.

mappings.description:
Mapping for fields in the index.
If specified, this mapping can include: field names, field data types (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-types.html), mapping parameters (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-params.html).
**NOTE:** changing datatypes in the existing *mappings* will force index to be re-created.

name.description: Name of the index you wish to create.

settings.description:
Configuration options for the index. See, https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/index-modules.html#index-modules-settings.
**NOTE:** Static index settings (see: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/index-modules.html#*static*index_settings) can be only set on the index creation and later cannot be removed or updated - *apply* will return error

settingsRaw.description: All raw settings fetched from the cluster.

cold.description: The index is no longer being updated and is queried infrequently. The information still needs to be searchable, but its okay if those queries are slower.

delete.description: The index is no longer needed and can safely be removed.

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

frozen.description: The index is no longer being updated and is queried rarely. The information still needs to be searchable, but its okay if those queries are extremely slow.

hot.description: The index is actively being updated and queried.

metadata.description: Optional user metadata about the ilm policy. Must be valid JSON document.

modifiedDate.description: The DateTime of the last modification.

name.description: Identifier for the policy.

warm.description: The index is no longer being updated but is still being queried.

elasticstack:index/elasticsearchIngestPi.description:
## Import



```sh
 $ pulumi import elasticstack:index/elasticsearchIngestPipeline:ElasticsearchIngestPipeline my_ingest_pipeline <cluster_uuid>/<ingest pipeline name>
```

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

metadata.description: Optional user metadata about the index template.

name.description: The name of the ingest pipeline.

onFailures.description: Processors to run immediately after a processor failure. Each processor supports a processor-level `on_failure` value. If a processor without an `on_failure` value fails, Elasticsearch uses this pipeline-level parameter as a fallback. The processors in this parameter run sequentially in the order specified. Elasticsearch will not attempt to run the pipelines remaining processors. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/processors.html. Each record must be a valid JSON document

processors.description: Processors used to perform transformations on documents before indexing. Processors run sequentially in the order specified. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/processors.html. Each record must be a valid JSON document.

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

metadata.description: Optional user metadata about the index template.

name.description: The name of the ingest pipeline.

onFailures.description: Processors to run immediately after a processor failure. Each processor supports a processor-level `on_failure` value. If a processor without an `on_failure` value fails, Elasticsearch uses this pipeline-level parameter as a fallback. The processors in this parameter run sequentially in the order specified. Elasticsearch will not attempt to run the pipelines remaining processors. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/processors.html. Each record must be a valid JSON document

processors.description: Processors used to perform transformations on documents before indexing. Processors run sequentially in the order specified. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/processors.html. Each record must be a valid JSON document.

Elasticsearch will not attempt to run the pipelines remaining processors. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/processors.html. Each record must be a valid JSON document

enabled.description: Specifies whether the user is enabled. The default value is true.

fullName.description: The full name of the user.

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata that you want to associate with the user.

password.description: The users password. Passwords must be at least 6 characters long.

passwordHash.description: A hash of the users password. This must be produced using the same hashing algorithm as has been configured for password storage (see https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/security-settings.html#hashing-settings).

roles.description: A set of roles the user has. The roles determine the users access permissions. Default is [].

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata that you want to associate with the user.

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

expandWildcards.description: Determines how wildcard patterns in the `indices` parameter match data streams and indices. Supports comma-separated values, such as `closed,hidden`.

expireAfter.description: Time period after which a snapshot is considered expired and eligible for deletion.

featureStates.description: Feature states to include in the snapshot.

ignoreUnavailable.description: If `false`, the snapshot fails if any data stream or index in indices is missing or closed. If `true`, the snapshot ignores missing or closed data streams and indices.

includeGlobalState.description: If `true`, include the cluster state in the snapshot.

indices.description: Comma-separated list of data streams and indices to include in the snapshot.

maxCount.description: Maximum number of snapshots to retain, even if the snapshots have not yet expired.

metadata.description: Attaches arbitrary metadata to the snapshot.

minCount.description: Minimum number of snapshots to retain, even if the snapshots have expired.

name.description: ID for the snapshot lifecycle policy you want to create or update.

partial.description: If `false`, the entire snapshot will fail if one or more indices included in the snapshot do not have all primary shards available.

repository.description: Repository used to store snapshots created by this policy.

schedule.description: Periodic or absolute schedule at which the policy creates snapshots.

snapshotName.description: Name automatically assigned to each snapshot created by the policy.

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

expandWildcards.description: Determines how wildcard patterns in the `indices` parameter match data streams and indices. Supports comma-separated values, such as `closed,hidden`.

expireAfter.description: Time period after which a snapshot is considered expired and eligible for deletion.

featureStates.description: Feature states to include in the snapshot.

ignoreUnavailable.description: If `false`, the snapshot fails if any data stream or index in indices is missing or closed. If `true`, the snapshot ignores missing or closed data streams and indices.

includeGlobalState.description: If `true`, include the cluster state in the snapshot.

indices.description: Comma-separated list of data streams and indices to include in the snapshot.

azure.description: Support for using Azure Blob storage as a repository for Snapshot/Restore. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/repository-azure.html

elasticsearchConnection.description: Used to establish connection to Elasticsearch server. Overrides environment variables if present.

fs.description: Shared filesystem repository. Repositories of this type use a shared filesystem to store snapshots. This filesystem must be accessible to all master and data nodes in the cluster.

gcs.description: Support for using the Google Cloud Storage service as a repository for Snapshot/Restore. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/repository-gcs.html

hdfs.description: Support for using HDFS File System as a repository for Snapshot/Restore. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/repository-hdfs.html

name.description: Name of the snapshot repository to register or update.

s3.description: Support for using AWS S3 as a repository for Snapshot/Restore. See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/repository-s3-repository.html

url.description: URL repository. Repositories of this type are read-only for the cluster. This means the cluster can retrieve or restore snapshots from the repository but cannot write or create snapshots in it.

verify.description: If true, the request verifies the repository is functional on all master and data nodes in the cluster.

elasticstack:index/elasticsearchIngestPr.description:
Similar to the Grok Processor, dissect also extracts structured fields out of a single text field within a document. However unlike the Grok Processor, dissect does not use Regular Expressions. This allows dissects syntax to be simple and for some cases faster than the Grok Processor.

Dissect matches a single text field against a defined pattern.


See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/dissect-processor.html

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorDissect.

appendSeparator.description: The character(s) that separate the appended fields.

field.description: The field to dissect.

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document.

pattern.description: The pattern to apply to the field.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorDissect.

appendSeparator.description: The character(s) that separate the appended fields.

field.description: The field to dissect.

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document.

json.description: JSON representation of this data source.

pattern.description: The pattern to apply to the field.

field.description: The field to expand into an object field. If set to *, all top-level fields will be expanded.

override.description: Controls the behavior when there is already an existing nested object that conflicts with the expanded field.

path.description: The field that contains the field to expand.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorDotExpander.

maxMatches.description: The maximum number of matched documents to include under the configured target field.

override.description: If processor will update fields with pre-existing non-null-valued field.

policyName.description: The name of the enrich policy to use.

shapeRelation.description: A spatial relation operator used to match the geoshape of incoming documents to documents in the enrich index.

targetField.description: Field added to incoming documents to contain enrich data.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorEnrich.

databaseFile.description: The database filename referring to a database the module ships with (GeoLite2-City.mmdb, GeoLite2-Country.mmdb, or GeoLite2-ASN.mmdb) or a custom database in the `ingest-geoip` config directory.

firstOnly.description: If `true` only first found geoip data will be returned, even if field contains array.

elasticstack:index/elasticsearchIngestPr.description:
Extracts structured fields out of a single text field within a document. You choose which field to extract matched fields from, as well as the grok pattern you expect will match. A grok pattern is like a regular expression that supports aliased expressions that can be reused.

This processor comes packaged with many [reusable patterns](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/master/libs/grok/src/main/resources/patterns).

If you need help building patterns to match your logs, you will find the [Grok Debugger](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/master/xpack-grokdebugger.html) tool quite useful! [The Grok Constructor](https://grokconstructor.appspot.com/) is also a useful tool.


See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/grok-processor.html

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorGrok.

ecsCompatibility.description: Must be disabled or v1. If v1, the processor uses patterns with Elastic Common Schema (ECS) field names. **NOTE:** Supported only starting from version of Elasticsearch **7.16.x**.

field.description: The field to use for grok expression parsing

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document

patternDefinitions.description: A map of pattern-name and pattern tuples defining custom patterns to be used by the current processor. Patterns matching existing names will override the pre-existing definition.

patterns.description: An ordered list of grok expression to match and extract named captures with. Returns on the first expression in the list that matches.

traceMatch.description: when true, `_ingest._grok_match_index` will be inserted into your matched documents metadata with the index into the pattern found in `patterns` that matched.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorGrok.

ecsCompatibility.description: Must be disabled or v1. If v1, the processor uses patterns with Elastic Common Schema (ECS) field names. **NOTE:** Supported only starting from version of Elasticsearch **7.16.x**.

field.description: The field to use for grok expression parsing

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document

json.description: JSON representation of this data source.

patternDefinitions.description: A map of pattern-name and pattern tuples defining custom patterns to be used by the current processor. Patterns matching existing names will override the pre-existing definition.

patterns.description: An ordered list of grok expression to match and extract named captures with. Returns on the first expression in the list that matches.

traceMatch.description: when true, `_ingest._grok_match_index` will be inserted into your matched documents metadata with the index into the pattern found in `patterns` that matched.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorGsub.

field.description: The field to apply the replacement to.

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document.

replacement.description: The string to replace the matching patterns with.

targetField.description: The field to assign the converted value to, by default `field` is updated in-place.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorGsub.

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorHtmlStrip.

targetField.description: The field to assign the converted value to, by default `field` is updated in-place.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorJoin.

field.description: Field containing array values to join.

targetField.description: The field to assign the converted value to, by default `field` is updated in-place.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorJoin.

field.description: Field containing array values to join.

json.description: JSON representation of this data source.

targetField.description: The field to assign the converted value to, by default `field` is updated in-place.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorJson.

addToRoot.description: Flag that forces the parsed JSON to be added at the top level of the document. `target_field` must not be set when this option is chosen.

addToRootConflictStrategy.description: When set to `replace`, root fields that conflict with fields from the parsed JSON will be overridden. When set to `merge`, conflicting fields will be merged. Only applicable if `add_to_root` is set to `true`.

allowDuplicateKeys.description: When set to `true`, the JSON parser will not fail if the JSON contains duplicate keys. Instead, the last encountered value for any duplicate key wins.

field.description: The field to be parsed.

targetField.description: The field that the converted structured object will be written into. Any existing content in this field will be overwritten.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorJson.

addToRoot.description: Flag that forces the parsed JSON to be added at the top level of the document. `target_field` must not be set when this option is chosen.

addToRootConflictStrategy.description: When set to `replace`, root fields that conflict with fields from the parsed JSON will be overridden. When set to `merge`, conflicting fields will be merged. Only applicable if `add_to_root` is set to `true`.

allowDuplicateKeys.description: When set to `true`, the JSON parser will not fail if the JSON contains duplicate keys. Instead, the last encountered value for any duplicate key wins.

field.description: The field to be parsed.

json.description: JSON representation of this data source.

targetField.description: The field that the converted structured object will be written into. Any existing content in this field will be overwritten.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorKv.

excludeKeys.description: List of keys to exclude from document

field.description: The field to be parsed. Supports template snippets.

fieldSplit.description: Regex pattern to use for splitting key-value pairs.

ignoreMissing.description: If `true` and `field` does not exist or is `null`, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document.

includeKeys.description: List of keys to filter and insert into document. Defaults to including all keys

prefix.description: Prefix to be added to extracted keys.

stripBrackets.description: If `true` strip brackets `()`, `<>`, `[]` as well as quotes `'` and `"` from extracted values.

targetField.description: The field to insert the extracted keys into. Defaults to the root of the document.

trimKey.description: String of characters to trim from extracted keys.

trimValue.description: String of characters to trim from extracted values.

valueSplit.description: Regex pattern to use for splitting the key from the value within a key-value pair.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorKv.

excludeKeys.description: List of keys to exclude from document

prefix.description: Prefix to be added to extracted keys.

stripBrackets.description: If `true` strip brackets `()`, `<>`, `[]` as well as quotes `'` and `"` from extracted values.

targetField.description: The field to insert the extracted keys into. Defaults to the root of the document.

trimKey.description: String of characters to trim from extracted keys.

trimValue.description: String of characters to trim from extracted values.

valueSplit.description: Regex pattern to use for splitting the key from the value within a key-value pair.

elasticstack:index/elasticsearchIngestPr.description:
Runs an inline or stored script on incoming documents. The script runs in the ingest context.

The script processor uses the script cache to avoid recompiling the script for each incoming document. To improve performance, ensure the script cache is properly sized before using a script processor in production.

See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/script-processor.html

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking ElasticsearchIngestProcessorScript.

params.description: Object containing parameters for the script.

scriptId.description: ID of a stored script. If no `source` is specified, this parameter is required.

source.description: Inline script. If no id is specified, this parameter is required.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by ElasticsearchIngestProcessorScript.

json.description: JSON representation of this data source.

params.description: Object containing parameters for the script.

scriptId.description: ID of a stored script. If no `source` is specified, this parameter is required.

source.description: Inline script. If no id is specified, this parameter is required.

field.description: The field to insert, upsert, or update.

ignoreEmptyValue.description: If `true` and `value` is a template snippet that evaluates to `null` or the empty string, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document

mediaType.description: The media type for encoding value.

override.description: If processor will update fields with pre-existing non-null-valued field.

value.description: The value to be set for the field. Supports template snippets. May specify only one of `value` or `copy_from`.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing elasticstack cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vinaybabu16/terraform-provider-elasticstack)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-elasticstack` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-elasticstack/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`vinaybabu16/terraform-provider-elasticstack` repo](https://github.com/vinaybabu16/terraform-provider-elasticstack/issues).
